A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: This film was a Star Wars movie in name only.  It was the only SW movie in my 40+ year history of enjoying these films on opening weekend that I've ever turned to the people I was with afterwards and put two thumbs down.  I was like \"what the eff did I just watch\, because it wasn't Star Wars and that sure as sh*t wasn't Luke Skywalker?\".  I can appreciate taking the franchise down a different path\, but not when that path leads directly to a toilet.  Many others have stated their dislikes which I completely share\, and I won't reiterate them in this post.  I hated this movie so much that I sold my stock in Disney because if they can't take care of Star Wars\, then what can they take care of?  I don't see how the damage to the franchise can be repaired in the next film.  The Skywalker Saga is dead and Rian Johnson killed it.
